availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky farmer. Virginia native. Married to Emily Owen Wooldridge on February 20, 1838. Father of Mary J. Wooldridge, Leonora Wooldridge, Josephine Wooldridge, John C. Wooldridge, Sarah E. Wooldridge, William T. Wooldridge, Francis H. Wooldridge, Rodman Wooldridge, Warder Wooldridge, and Laura Wooldridge. Employed as a farmer in Franklin County in 1850. Owned five enslaved people in 1850. Employed as a farmer in Franklin County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved people in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Franklin County Marriages, Film #817877, p. 272.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 85B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 907.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 382
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 500.
